...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN GRAND RAPIDS HAS CANCELLED THE
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. 

HAZARDOUS WEATHER...

 * RAIN AND DRIZZLE WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT. 

 * THE RAIN WILL SWITCH TO SNOW VERY LATE TONIGHT OR TOWARD DAYBREAK. 

IMPACTS...

 * SOME UNTREATED SIDE STREETS COULD STILL HAVE SCATTERED SLIPPERY
   SPOTS...BUT THE MAIN ROADS WILL JUST REMAIN WET. 

 * ANY SNOW ACCUMULATION BY MORNING WILL ONLY BE A DUSTING.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

 * SEND REPORTS TO NWS GRAND RAPIDS OR VISIT WEATHER.GOV/GRR FOR 
   MORE INFORMATION.

...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST
SUNDAY...

HAZARDOUS WEATHER...

 * SNOW WILL MIX WITH SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN THIS EVENING. THE
   PRECIPITATION INTENSITY WILL TAPER OFF OR EVEN END FOR A PERIOD
   TONIGHT. THEN THE SNOW IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE AGAIN AFTER 3 AM.

 * ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATION OVERNIGHT SHOULD GENERALLY BE AN
   INCH OR LESS. AN ADDITIONAL 2 TO 3 INCHES IS EXPECTED SUNDAY.
   TOTAL SNOW ACCUMULATION THROUGH SUNDAY WILL RANGE FROM 4 TO 7
   INCHES WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

 * THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION REMINDS MOTORISTS 
   TO ADJUST SPEEDS BASED ON THE CONDITIONS... AND TO TAKE IT 
   SLOW IN ICE AND SNOW. 

 * WEATHER PREPAREDNESS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON LINE AT 
   WWW.READY.GOV/WINTER AND HTTP://GO.USA.GOV/5OG.
